question: 無事
sourceMnemonic: The <kanji>action</kanji>s around here are <kanji>nothing</kanji>. Absolutely nothing is going on. If nothing is going on, that means it is <vocabulary>safe and sound</vocabulary> for you.
sourceReadingMnemonic: One thing that's not safe and sound is the reading of the <ja>無</ja> in this word. Instead of <ja>む</ja> it's <ja>ぶ</ja>. Why? Because you thought it was safe and sound, but you were fooled. There are ghosts everywhere, all jumping out and screaming <reading>Boo!</reading> (<ja>ぶ</ja>) at you. Feel the surprise. You thought it was safe and sound!
